[justify][author]\033MTerracorp[/author]Dear %s,

landed rulers of the Commonwealth are obligated to report Terraformer activities to us. The machines expand from a [red]Maelstrom[/red] in the sector %s. We want your assessment whether this is an existential threat to all biological life in this outer border galaxy.

[yellow]Xenon Crisis Mechanic:[/yellow]
When the galaxy is in danger Terracorp will force everyone to stop their wars and unite in a big coalition. But since Terracorp has to tend to thousands of other galaxies they cannot pay much attention and rely on Xenon reports from all factions.
The undertone of your own Xenon reports can be changed in the [white]personal journal[/white].
Terracorp listens extra carefully to the absolute majority of combined military power in the Commonwealth. Weak factions with Xenon problems often work towards a global coalition. Strong factions want to prevent it. There is a new diplomatic [white]favor action[/white] which allows to write the Xenon reports for other empires.[/justify]

[justify][author]\033MTerracorp[/author]We just received your report about the global Terraformer progress. According to you they are almost at the gates to Terra itself!
Look, its out of the question that your assessment is valuable to us. But we wonder why your report contradicts our own observations so severely. Please remember that we have to consider the state of the entire galaxy and will only react if biological LIFE itself is at stake. According to our other intel sources this doesn't seem to be the case yet.

Maybe you have your own severe problems with the OCV. Be assured that we send our honest condolences. But we simply cannot take away the freedom to wage war in this outer bordre galaxy. At least not yet.

[yellow]The global progress of the Terraformers is simply too low right now. Terracorp will refuse to declare a coalition against them. No sitrep will sway them at this point, even if you'd convince all factions to warn them like you just did. Try again when the Xenon own much more sectors or when the OCV fleet has grown much stronger.[/yellow][/justify]

[author][yellow]Tutorial[/yellow][/author]Terracorp has just declared a global [yellow]Xenon Crisis[/yellow]!

> the main faction wars have stopped! Everyone is allied.
> your permanent wars get suppressed until this crisis is over.
> all sectors are Protectorates with severe consequences if you ignore that
> special bounty rewards for OCV and Xenon kills!
> many volunteers have joined the fight! Terracorp covers three quarters of all mercenary costs!

The United Commonwealth needs to fight the Xenon back to their Maelstrom sector. If you win this war the machines will be crippled for a long time. As you read this, all factions have already started to work hard to achieve this goal. What will you do? This is the time when legends and heroes are born!

[author][yellow]Tutorial[/yellow][/author]Tip: if a Trader does not belong to one of the main factions you can scan his cargo and kill him without damaging your reputation! You can even set up fully automated piracy fleets!
However, killing innocent civilian ships will add to your [yellow]Infamy[/yellow]. Right now you have %s. Criminal or honorable playstyles are both viable with different benefits. And you can also switch between them.

[white]Honorable = NO infamy:[/white]
[green]+ the neutral Trader Union frequently bribes you with money[/green]
[green]+ during a Xenon Crisis the UNC forces might gift sectors to you[/green]
[green]+ refugees can come to boost your Taxes and Waste.[/green]

[white]Criminal = 1 or more Infamy:[/white]
[red]----- you cannot get any Truce. \(gaining reputation still possible\).[/red]
[red]--- you cannot buy Sectors or Favor actions.[/red]
[red]-- higher risk that your Zone of Control over adjacent Unknown sectors gets ignored.[/red]
[red]- the Trade Union might fund private security ships instead of you.[/red]
[red]- no Police License for you[/red]
[green]+++ Free Loot from robbing the weak![/green]
[green]+++ Pirates tend to leave you and your buisness partners alone[/green]
[green]++ Nomad mercs fear you, stay for longer and will never turn rogue on you[/green]
[green]+ better Spaceweed production and client ships can come to buy directly[/green]
[green]+ increased Mercenary recruitment range.[/green]
> most criminal effects get more intense with more infamy, but having any infamy at all usually already has the largest impact.

[white]Gaining Infamy:[/white]
- destroying neutral Traders, Nomad ships and especially refugee transports.
- breaking truces and non aggression agreements
- violating the galactic peace during a Xenon Crisis

[white]Loosing Infamy:[/white]
- it slowly decays over time
- a general amnesty will clear most of it after a Xenon Crisis.
> if you accumulate much more than about 10 infamy you will need the amnesty to realistically get it down and switch to the honorable playstyle again.

[author][green]Freelancer Trade Union[/green][/author]You have been registered in our special philantropist program and received %s credits from the Freelancer Relief Fund.

We thank you for your peaceful interaction with the civilian sector and hope for a lasting partnership.

[yellow]Tutorial:[/yellow]
The neutral Traders in this galaxy are organized. They basically just bribed you. Its a reward which gets frequently paid as long as you don't have any infamy.
The amount of credits depends on your combined military power in relation to the other main factions. It won't cover your entire ship maintenance, but it is a reliable secondary income.

[author][green]GalNewsNet[/green][/author]The United Commonwealth has declared victory over the dreadful Xenon Empire. The global crisis has come to an end.
Scattered Terraformer remains are getting routed across the entire galaxy. Our brave soldiers will send them back through their hellish Maelstrom in the sector %s. Where they will hopefully stay forever!
Our species have proven that we can stand united side by side. Calls are being made that we should not fall back into old habits of war and the general public is weary of it.

[yellow]Tutorial:[/yellow]
The Terraformers are completely crippled and won't be able to reinforce their fleets for a while. But eventually they will return.
All main empires should be pretty burned out of resources by now. That's why they will probably keep the peace for some time and try to rebuild this galaxy.

[author]Flagship of the Nomad Fleet[/author]To everyone fleeing from the Xenon Empire,

We are experienced survivors of countless other galaxies that the OCV destroyed before yours.

Never give up buddy! We have work for your wife and kids in our factory ships. Listen, you don't really have any options left, so this is the deal. We give you a military ship, you go earn some cash and then pay us back...

[yellow]Tutorial:[/yellow]
The [yellow]Nomads[/yellow] are a new wandering alien faction. They follow the OCV into other galaxies to exploit the refugee chaos that the machines leave behind. The Nomad elite lives in their Flagship, a mobile shipyard. Desperate refugees who arrive at the Nomad Flagship get armed and sent back into the galaxy to become mercs for hire. But they have lots of debt and their families are being held hostage.

Nomad mercs work for [yellow]half the price[/yellow]. But they are not very experienced or disciplined. Eventually they run away \(stealing the upfront hiring fee\), or even try their luck as a new pirate gang! Only an [yellow]infamous[/yellow] leader could keep them in line long enough to build a real merc army.

[yellow]Tutorial[/yellow][/author]You have just received %s new people in your %s! They are [yellow]Refugees[/yellow] from a sector which got attacked by the Terraformers.

Refugees will only come to your Outposts if you are honorable \(no infamy\). This allows to exceed the usual population limit by up to the double amount to get more Taxes, Waste generation and production speed. But keep in mind that these additional people cannot regrow naturally if you start building ships, which requires pilots, or if a desease or famine reduces your total population.

Harming innocent refugees would quickly turn you into a very evil person. And you wouldn't want that, do you?

[author]Nomad Merc Broadcast[/author]Fellow Nomads! The time has come for us to take revenge on the Xenon! Wipe the machines from the face of this galaxy!

Avenge your families!

Honor your fallen brothers and sisters!

ATTACK!

[yellow]Tutorial:[/yellow]
Most Nomad mercs in the galaxy will follow this call to arms. The fools are currently betraying their current contracts to attack the Xenon Empire.

[author][yellow]Tutorial[/yellow][/author]Tip to [yellow]save money[/yellow]:
The default mindset of your Outposts is to keep every ware stored inside unless you tell them to sell it. This often causes certain problems for new players.
For example your [yellow]random Loot does not get sold[/yellow], and your Traders will often buy something but they miss their planned selling opportunity and just [yellow]dump all their junk into your Outpost and then go buy even more[/yellow].

If you don't tell your Outposts to sell you will create many [yellow]useless stockpiles[/yellow] of random goods everywhere. [yellow]This burns your money[/yellow].

Previously this could only be fixed by deep diving into the Outpost trade settings for an hour or so.

But the Zero Hour Mod has a very neat little Tool called [yellow]QuickTrade[/yellow] which fixes all these issues in a couple of clicks.

QuickTrade basically changes the general mindset of your Outposts from hoarding everything \(burning your cash\) towards selling everything that you do not need. And Traders will not buy what their Outpost already wants to sell.

You can expand and collapse the list of QuickTrade modules in the Logistics>Trade section of your Outpost Manager. You always need to tell QuickTrade what kind of Outpost you want by combining different modules. For example a station crafting Outpost that doesn't buy anything should get modules 1, 2 and 5.
